Description: Sandstone door-jamb: bearing incised hieroglyphic text on the front including prenomen of Thutmose III. The monument has been re-assembled from the two pieces into which it was broken. Small portions have been broken off from the top and sides, but the text, although slightly weathered, remains legible throughout.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Buhen (Nubia), Temple of Thutmose III
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' VII (Oxford: Clarendon Press), p.141; E. A. W. Budge, ‘The Egyptian Sûdân : its history and monuments’ (London, 1907), p. 584; A. Wiedemann, ‘Recueil de Travaux relatifs à la philology et à ‘archéologie égyptiennes et assyriennes' 17 (Paris, 1895), p. 6. I. Regulski (ed.), Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt (London, 2022), p. 149
Bibliographic references: Edwards 1939 / Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae e.t.c. in the British Museum (pl.4)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
